channel.title: Banned From School Computers
channel.description:
Last Friday I was looking threw my computers BIOS at school, when the teacher turned and saw what I was looking at - he asked what I was doing and I replayed "just looking at the BIOS, i've always wondered what was inside this", he then yelled "I know what you are doing get out!". (note I have 2 computer class's) I came back Monday to find out I can no longer use school computers as my account is disabled. I've tried talking with my Principal about this issue but he insists I was "hacking" and breaking the school's computer usage policy.
Now i've looked over the policy yet I don't see what he is talking about. I am going to fail both of these class's and have to take makeup class's next year to graduate (I am a junior).
Do you think I should have been banned from them?
tl;dr I got banned from my school computer for looking at the BIOS
Pic related - its the policy.
[img]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=431177.0;attach=17777[/img]

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

(Anthony):

Ha, you got caught not even hacking into anything when I managed to get into my teachers account and get the answers to all my tests and haven’t gotten caught… (The teachers shit is on the same drive as all the student shit on a drive you get full access to. LOL)

That’s so awesome! I can’t believe it, how’d you do it? Oh wait, I don’t give a shit, go fuck yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

cumescape:

No harm to foul, BIOS has a password nothing could have been done. I got the same information I got from “System Information” in Windows.

technically can also get you b& from the computers

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I think you should just suck it up and deal with it, to be completely honest. You did something wrong, based on their policy (a policy you no doubt agreed to be subjected to).
Also, there’s absolutely no reason that you need to be in the bios on a school computer. Do that stuff on your own time using your own computer, at home.

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote author=jme link=topic=431177.msg3172393#msg3172393 date=1270526182] Basically I wouldn't want a bunch of highschool twats fucking with my BIOS either.

Anyways the solution was laid out already by someone: Parents. When parents bitch at schools, they can get anything for their children. You can fail a class and if your parents bitch enough you will pass. You can get suspended/expelled/detention and again your parents can always get you out of it.
[/quote]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=431177.msg3172174#msg3172174 date=1270518704]
Accessing the BIOS can definitely be considered as doing things with system configuration.
[/quote]

To both, the BIOS is password no harm can be done without the password. I can see what is happening but I cannot change anything in it. The IT guy should be back in school today, so I will see what happens and i’ll be back at 2 o’clock EST with what he says.

He says he can’t do anything or even side with me though I could do NO harm to the computer as the BIOS has a password…

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Basically I wouldn’t want a bunch of highschool twats fucking with my BIOS either.

Anyways the solution was laid out already by someone: Parents. When parents bitch at schools, they can get anything for their children. You can fail a class and if your parents bitch enough you will pass. You can get suspended/expelled/detention and again your parents can always get you out of it.

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:27, topic:334782”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=431177.msg3172198#msg3172198 date=1270519683]

Accessing the BIOS can definitely be considered as doing things with system configuration.

But I still don’t think that counts as a file on the harddrive.
[/quote]

BIOS configuration is stored in a file, not on the hard drive though. But the rules don’t say “configuration file on hard drive”, it basically just states “system configuration”, which can be the BIOS.[/quote]

Well, the way it sounds I bet these administrators are so stupid that they can’t figure out that there is separate place where BIOS settings are stored.

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:1, topic:335726”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=431177.msg3171968#msg3171968 date=1270510762]

Nueb35 you dont have a fucks clue what your talking about. The BIOS is not a “Network operating software” or a “System configuration file”

I think you don’t have a fucks clue what your talking about.

I think your a dumb fucking nigger so fuck off.
[/quote]

Your’e a fucking idiot, keep trying to impress your friends by “hacking” into the BIOS, and see how far you go in life[/quote]

I’ve been banned from the computers before, I suggest you write a letter to the adult that punished you. Make sure you note that you understand you’ve done something wrong, you’ll never do it again, and how much your grade depends on computers in the two classes you mentioned.

Better yet, write a letter and talk to them in person :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:26, topic:334782”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=431177.msg3172174#msg3172174 date=1270518704]
Accessing the BIOS can definitely be considered as doing things with system configuration.
[/quote]

But I still don’t think that counts as a file on the harddrive.[/quote]

BIOS configuration is stored in a file, not on the hard drive though. But the rules don’t say “configuration file on hard drive”, it basically just states “system configuration”, which can be the BIOS.

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

Cumescape lol this is so stupid honestly. This is about as bad as me getting ISS (In School Suspension) for downloading games, when all did was play a game someone else installed. And then the principle was being an jackass about it and on the referral put admitted to playing games (which wasn’t even against the rules).

Fuck the superintendent go to the Board of Education. Also get your parents involved. When I was falsely accused of compute crimes at school I was living with my grand parents and they don’t even know how to turn on a computer.

Also in your argument with your monkey superiors bring up the fact that if anyone hits a certain key in bootup they will access the BIOS.

Read full topic

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You broke the rules, no doubt about that so don’t disagree with that. The punishment is another thing and the fact that you never should have been able to access BIOS I can agree with the punishment being to big.

item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Nueb35 you dont have a fucks clue what your talking about. The BIOS is not a “Network operating software” or a “System configuration file”

Well if you stretch it enough, the BIOS could be classified as “Configuration” because you can “configure” which drives boot first, and all the other shit you can do with it.

They really are incompetent. A couple of years ago I found out the IP to their main database (they only have a range of like 5) and they said I was “hacking” & trying to get into students personal information.

item.title: Banned From School Computers
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

Tell them to give back your access or you will hack the server and create a new account for yourself.

Or take it to the school board and tell them their staff is completely incompetent and putting you at risk of failing two classes for their lack of understanding of their own policy

Read full topic
